Pickens County will be under a wind advisory as a result of Hurricane Irma beginning on Monday, September 11, 2017 at 9:00 a.m. Each year as we encounter the hurricane season, questions arise regarding the safety of buses during periods of gusting or sustained high winds. When wind forces of 30 MPH or greater strike the side of a school bus, the forces exerted can exceed 500 pounds. Forces of this magnitude can greatly impact steering control and tracking of school buses in motion.

With this in mind, Pickens County Schools will be closed on Monday, September 11, 2017. A decision regarding Tuesday will be made on tomorrow afternoon. All central office staff should report to work on Monday at their regular time.

Please be safe and weather aware.

Safety is our #1 priority.

Aliceville High School names Mr. Melvin Pete, Jr. as the new Head Football Coach

On Monday, April 10, 2017, the Pickens County Board of Education approved the hiring of Mr. Melvin Pete, Jr. based on the recommendation of Superintendent Jamie Chapman from Principal Terry Sterling. He will serve as the physical education teacher and the Head Football Coach at Aliceville High School.

Coach Pete is a native of Jackson, Mississippi. He comes to us with an extensive coaching career at the high school and college levels with his most recent experience being at his alma mater, Provine High School. While coaching at Central High School in Tuscaloosa, he led the school to a state championship and was also responsible for having the longest winning streak in Alabama during that time.

We are excited to have him as a part of the Pickens County Schools‚Äô coaching staff.

We wish him much success as he works with our students to promote academic and athletic excellence.
